ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This is one of the best classes I have ever taken. The material is interesting and broad enough to allow people from different backgrounds and interests to get something out of this course. Professor Eyerman is a wonderful instructor and is very approachable. Take it.
Yes, would definitely encourage students interested in the study of trauma, historiography, historical fiction, comparative literature.... to take the course.
I will recommend to other studient, trauma study is an important topic in cultural sociology.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Directly applied to my research but also opened new perspectives. First exposure to sociology and social theory. Trauma theory applied to literature particularly interesting. Thought-provoking beyond academic fields too--definite connections to current events, popular media responses, etc
Great introduction to trauma and history writing.
I touch the core issue of trauma study, 'Culture Trauma' would become an important research perspective in my further studies.Thanks, indeed.
